title: Nigel Benn 'could die' when he fights Sakio Bika, former manager fears
text:

Nigel Benn is risking his life when he returns to the ring more than 20 years after quitting boxing, his former manager said.

Benn, 55, takes on fellow former world title holder Sakio Bika, 40, in Birmingham on November 23.

But Peter DeFreitas fears Benn could suffer a fatal injury because of his age in what will be his first fight since his defeat to Steve Collins in 1996.

“I haven’t said a word about Nigel in 23 years but now he’s fighting again it’s time to talk," DeFreitas said to the Daily Star.

"I’m talking because I’m concerned - I fear for his life.”

(Image: PA)

DeFreitas trained Benn in 2017 and admits he is "very fit".

He believes Benn will "look good for a couple of rounds" but says he fears the worst when he starts taking blows to the head.

“For a man of his age he was very fit," said DeFreitas. “But what happens when he’s under pressure, his hands drop and he starts taking punches to the head?

“He will look good for a couple of rounds and then what happens?

(Image: PA Archive)

“Being fit and fighting are two different things. He’s risking his life."

DeFreitas fears one bout will not be enough for Benn, with his old adversary Collins having been touted as an opponent should the former WBO middleweight and WBC super-middleweight champion beat Bika.

"My fear is he will carry on if he wins" said DeFreitas.

"Steve Collins has already said he would fight Nigel again if the money was right and if he beats Bika it could happen.”

(Image: Getty Images)

A head-trauma specialist with a brain scanner will be employed on the night.

But Benn and his agent both say the British boxer is in the shape of his life.

Benn said: “I’ve not stopped training since I retired. If I tell you that I’m more fit now, you better believe me. I’m in great shape, I really am.

“It’s not about age. I’m in training all the time, I’ve got army discipline.

(Image: Paisley Daily Express)

“My timing is good, my fitness levels now are through the roof.”

Agent Kevin Lueshing said: “He’s had a brain scan and doctors also said he’s got the heart of a 25-year-old.

“He’s hungry and looking forward to it, he’s as fit as a fiddle. He just wants to do justice to 55-year-olds everywhere.”
description: Peter DeFreitas fears 55-year-old Benn could suffer a fatal injury because of his age in his first fight for more than 20 years
